titlestmt.titleproper: Afro-American Presbyterian Council of the North and West records 1899-1955 1948-1955
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Afro-American Presbyterian Council of the North and West records

bioghist.p: The Afro-American Presbyterian Council of the North and West is a voluntary association of ministers and laymen representing churches in the Northern and Western portions of the United States. Among the Council's stated goals are facilitating the more complete integration of the African American constituency into the thought, program, structure, and fellowship of the Presbyterian Church, U.S.A., and furtherance of responsible participation and opportunities for leadership in the activities and obligations of the Church.

scopecontent.p: Included in the collection are programs of annual meetings; later programs include lists of meeting attendees, Council officers, reports of committees, and copies of the Council's constitution. Dates are 1899, 1948, and 1950-1955.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
